body_html:
Some strange things. Why do you run (20, 16K)? I thought 16K labels with dense tensors of size 512 is more realistic?

But, more importantly, it's strange that Defun makes things slow. When benchmarking TF one always has to first run the benchmark a few hundred steps without measuring, just to warm-up the graph and stuff. Are you doing that?
body_text:
Some strange things. Why do you run (20, 16K)? I thought 16K labels with dense tensors of size 512 is more realistic?
But, more importantly, it's strange that Defun makes things slow. When benchmarking TF one always has to first run the benchmark a few hundred steps without measuring, just to warm-up the graph and stuff. Are you doing that?
body:
Some strange things. Why do you run (20, 16K)? I thought 16K labels with dense tensors of size 512 is more realistic?

But, more importantly, it's strange that Defun makes things slow. When benchmarking TF one always has to first run the benchmark a few hundred steps without measuring, just to warm-up the graph and stuff. Are you doing that?
